docs.lead_paragraph: What do stock analysts know about medical research? Last month Wall Street got nervous about the safety of two of the hottest prescription drugs on the market, Celebrex and Vioxx, after a company-sponsored study suggested that they might increase susceptibility to heart attacks. The two are nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs that greatly reduce the risk of ulcers associated with older over-the-counter and prescription rivals, ibuprofen (Advil and Motrin), naproxen (Aleve and Naprosyn), indomethacin (Indocin) and aspirin.

headline.main: Newest Pain Killers Deserve a Closer Look

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column on concerns about safety of two nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, Celebrex, made by Pharmacia, and Vioxx, made by Merck, after study suggested that they might increase susceptibility to heart attacks (M)
